required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Respiratory Muscle Training in Elderly Hypertensive Women With Respiratory Muscle Weakness
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Respiratory Muscle Training in Elderly Hypertensive Women With Respiratory Muscle Weakness

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

collaborator.agency: Foundation for research support from the state of Rio Grande do Norte (FAPERN)

clinical_study.source: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate pulmonary function and respiratory muscle strength in a group of elderly women with hypertension before and after a respiratory muscle training.

detailed_description.textblock: It is a respiratory muscle training using the Threshold for 5 weeks, with a load of 30% of maximal inspiratory pressure obtained in manometer for 30 minutes daily. Furthermore, the assessment includes: test 6-minute walk, the quality of life questionnaire, MINICHAL, the IPAQ short version, manometer and spirometry.

other_outcome.description: Assesses the influence of hypertension on the quality of life of target
assesses the cardiopulmonary capacity at sub-maximal
assesses the level of physical activity

arm_group.description: Held inspiratory muscle strengthening for 5 weeks with Threshold, charging 30% of maximal inspiratory pressure, 7 days a week, one supervised and unsupervised 6.

intervention.description: The load adjustment was done weekly by a single examiner.

overall_official.affiliation: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

facility.name: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Norte
responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Patra-cia Angelica de Miranda Silva Nogueira
responsible_party.investigator_title: Patrícia Angélica de Miranda Silva Nogueira
